text: <@U05RNDM3VM2> I see, unfortunately that isn't a supported feature.  Local dev mode only engages for the machine that is running `hs project dev` and the other users only see what is currently deployed.  If you want to achieve this you could attempt to forward the ports being used by `hs project dev` from the machine you wish to view it on to the remote machine.  I haven't attempted this, so I can't promise it will work, and it does come with caveat that the `hs project dev` doesn't always use the same ports (depending on availability).
That's not currently supported.  We default to using ports `5173` and `5174` if they are available, but that is subject to change.

> we work with remote machines in the companies is our usual development workflow
May I know why is that the case? That'll help me understand your set up and limitations

Reminder: Don’t forget to keep your HubSpot CLI up to date to ensure you have the latest CLI features, bug/usability fixes and performance improvements. • <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/developer-reference/local-development-cli#upgrade|How to upgrade your CLI to the latest version>.

> That’s not currently supported.  We default to using ports `5173` and `5174` if they are available, but that is subject to change.
SO if we free those ports it would be okay then?

Basically our environment is pretty complex so we use virtual machines to centralize and make it easier for the DX team to have it running smoothly for every developer
